result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel P Cera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 5/01/2016 along with payment plan fee of $15.00. Alternate 21 days jail.
DNA to be paid along with fine on payment plan.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel P Cera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Gamino Law Offices
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daniel P Cera in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Court imposed the following sentence: 

Fine:   $694.00
DNA Surcharge $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  
Defendant to pay $25.00 a month commencing 05/01/2015 or alternate of 21 days jail
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel P Cera in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for plea and sentencing date as she is still waiting for the paperwork as to his counseling. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel P Cera in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant needs time to do some treatment and then will resolve the matter. Court grants adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daniel P Cera in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant would like the court to appoint counsel. Court grants and will appoint counsel. Defendant to pay $75.00 a month commencing 01/01/2016 and every month thereafter. Matter adjourned for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Daniel P Cera in court.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
